SEARCH
Package fastfoodfinal

Class Order

java.lang.Object
fastfoodfinal.Food
fastfoodfinal.Order
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Order extends Food implements Serializable
Represents a customer's food order within the fast food system. Manages the items in the order, order details, status, and automatic cancellation after a timeout period.
See Also:

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Order()
    Constructs a new Order with an empty cart, default description, unique order number, initial "Order Processing" status, dine-in option, and a total price of 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order()
      Constructs a new Order with an empty cart, default description, unique order number, initial "Order Processing" status, dine-in option, and a total price of 0.

  • Method Details

    • startScheduler

      public void startScheduler()
      Starts a timer that automatically changes the order status to "Cancelled" if it remains as "Ready for Pickup" for more than 30 seconds. Also shuts down the scheduler if the order status changes to "Completed".
